runs.comm: back of a length, angling away from off stump, and Hendricks leaves his first international delivery alone
short now, angling away again, and Reeza shapes to pull but decides against it in the end, lets it go

beauty, and it's a duck on debut for Reeza. His feet are stuck in cement as he pokes at this length ball, which leaves him slightly to accentuate the angle. Dunk dives low to his right to catch that outside edge
shortish ball, angling in, and he looks to pull and gets a bit of glove on it down to square leg
short ball, and that's a confident, swivelling pull from de Kock, but he can't beat the man at square leg
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, and he stands tall and slaps this to cover
length ball on off stump, and he stays in the crease and scoops it back over the bowler's head
a touch too straight, and he whips it off his hips to deep backward square leg
full on off stump and he drives but doesn't get hold of it, goes in the air between cover and mid-off
length ball on off, angling across the left-hander, and he looks to poke through the off side with an angled bat and gets an inside-edge to deep backward square leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
that's the yorker outside off. De Kock looks to walk across his stumps and play that to fine leg, but he only gets a bottom edge that rolls through to the keeper
shortish ball on off, angling in and cramping Rossouw. Punched into the covers
a little fuller, angling in towards off, and he pushes this to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length outside off. Rossouw tries to make room and slap that through the off side, can't connect

dropped Not a good day for debutants, eh? Reardon runs back from point after Rossouw top-edges a backfoot slash. The ball is coming down from behind him and he doesn't quite judge it right, drops between his hands
length ball, angling in towards off. He clears his front leg and shovels that over midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
on the pads, and he clips it down to deep backward square leg
shortish ball down the leg side. Looks to pull but can't quite connect. Off his thigh and into the leg side
length ball on middle stump. Looks to stay leg side of the ball and punch through the covers and gets an inside edge down to deep backward square leg
down the track now, and he doesn't quite time the drive but gets it into the gap between the stumps and mid-off
back of a length on leg stump. He backed away to make room and slapped that towards point
down the track now and he follows him down the leg side. Can't get his bat around his pad to flick, and it goes off the pad towards square leg
shot! That was angled in towards off stump, and he cleared his front leg and swung his bat through it cleanly to dump it over the wide long-on boundary
back of a length and a bit of width now. He gets on his toes and punches it away sweetly in front of point
and another. This is short outside off and he gets across, stands tall, and swivels his hips through a pull between short midwicket and mid-on. Super shot.
length ball outside off, pushed to mid-on. He was shaping for the lap-sweep before the bowler was even into his delivery stride
slower ball on off stump, blocked from the crease, into the off side
down the track, Bollinger pulls his length back a touch outside off. Rossouw tries to steer it away through point and the ball beats his bat
slanted across fairly full and he drives to the man at cover
full outside off. De Kock shuffles across and swings that  over the mat at deep midwicket. Cummins is the fielder and he leaps in the air but there was no chance he was catching that
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away towards short third man
length ball outside off. Stops on the batsman a little. He adjusts and pushes it down to mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra cover
down the track and that is such a clean strike from Rossouw. The angle across him gives him a bit of room and he simply extends his arms to launch it back over the bowler's head for six
fullish outside off, worked away with the turn to deep midwicket
full and wide, and he slaps it away to deep point. That was the googly
full on off stump and his bat made a lovely sound as he smacked that over midwicket, but it bounced well short of the rope and the man at deep midwicket stopped it running to his left.
fullish ball on the stumps, worked away to deep midwicket
short and wide and he slaps it towards deep backward point
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off
low full-toss on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
length ball on off stump. He goes on the back foot and punches it down to long-on
short on off stump and he pulls it away to the right of Cummins, the leg-side sweeper, and he covers a lot of ground and puts in the dive to stop that on the boundary
pulled away again, into a similar region, and Cummins runs around to do the fielding
back of a length outside off, punched down to long-off
makes room to flay this length ball through the off side, but it bounces a touch extra and beats his bat
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
a touch short, a lot of width, and he slaps it away towards deep point
goes back to a fairly full ball on off stump and slaps it away to sweeper cover
tossed up now and he carves it away over cover, again it's such a clean strike
slanted across, gives him a bit of width, and he cracks it away to the man at sweeper cover
fuller now and he drives it hard to the left of short cover. Long-off runs to his right to stop that
back of a length outside off, cut straight to backward point
back of a length on off stump, and de Kock works it away with the angle towards deep midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, dabbed to short third man
short, and he rises with the ball to pull it away between the converging fielders at deep square leg and deep midwicket
fuller now, on middle stump, and he pokes it down to long-on
length ball just outside off, and he makes room to slap it through the off side and misses. Ball missed off stump narrowly
starts this spell by angling a full ball down the leg side
length ball outside off and he leans over the ball and caresses it to the right of the desperately diving mid-off fielder
full on middle and leg, clipped away to deep square leg
down the track now and he bowls it short and wide. Rossouw flat-bats it to the cover boundary
short again, closer to off, and he goes back and across to pull to deep midwicket
short, angling into the body, and he pulls it down to deep midwicket
short again, a bit of extra bounce and he hits this pull uppishly, out of reach of deep midwicket, running to his right, and mid-on, running back
back of a length on the pads, whipped away to deep backward square leg
on the pads again, clipped towards deep square leg
slanted across and full, and de Kock swings it away over midwicket. Doesn't quite get hold of it, and the ball bounces once before crossing the boundary
short down the leg side and he helps it down towards long leg
slower ball, and he goes deep in his crease to pull that towards deep square leg
sees him coming down the track and bounces him. Was well above his head, so it was a fair call of wide from the umpire, but good thinking nonetheless from Cutting
down the track now and he pushes the ball down the ground towards mid-off
slower ball on the pads, clipped to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched sweetly but straight to short cover
shortish outside off and he plays that upright downward pull towards wide long-on
back of a length outside off, punched towards long-off
slower ball, angling away outside off and de Kock smacks that drive straight to cover
slower bouncer outside off and he ends up defending it into the off side with a wristy whipping motion
full, angled across wide of off, and he goes for the big drive and chops it into the ground
and there's the reverse sweep. Takes it from middle stump and hits it against the turn, easy as anything, between point and short third man
goes back to a length ball that turns in from outside off, gets a bit of an inside edge towards mid-on as he tries to punch down the ground
down the track now and he he launches this over the bowler's head with a full, fluid batswing
down the track again, gets inside the line, and goes over the covers this time, to beat long-off running to his right
flat and full on off stump, clears his front leg and swats it down the ground to long-off

dropped It's all going wrong for Australia. Cummins hurries de Kock with that bouncer. He goes for the pull, top-edges it, and White runs to his left from short midwicket, dives to his left to take it inches off the ground but can't wrap his fingers around it
slower ball now and he swats it away to deep square leg
bouncer slanted outside off, too high for the batsman to reach
full outside off, driven to deep cover
short ball on off stump, swivels into a pull down to deep midwicket
de Kock makes some room and Cummins follows with a fairly full ball, and he whips it away to deep midwicket
Cummins ends a lovely debut innings. It's short, angled across, he has to fetch the pull from really wide and ends up hitting it up in the air, simple catch to mid-on

what happened there? Went for the reverse-sweep. It was outside leg, and he ended up gloving it, the keeper messes up a simple chance, snatching at it, parrying it away, and nearly falling on his stumps in a doomed effort to retrieve the ball
got him. He came down the track, making room to hit through the off side, and ended up driving straight into the hands of short cover
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
straighter now and he works it away to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle stump and Duminy defends back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump and he goes deep in his crease to tuck it away towards deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of short cover
bouncer now, and Duminy ducks under it
length ball on off stump, stands tall and punches down the ground
short and wide, slapped to deep point
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and he goes back and across to block towards point
now he looks to bowl a bit straighter and ends up overdoing it, slants it wide down the leg side
length ball on middle stump, tucked away towards deep midwicket
length ball outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off. He stands tall and dabs it down towards point
full on off stump and he punches it back towards the bowler, who fields it with his left hand in his follow-through
full on middle and off, punched back to the bowler again
back of a length outside off now, punched down the ground and Faulkner can't quite cut that off, diving to his right
back of a length outside off, a bit of extra bounce. He let it come to him, and dabbed it away towards short third man
down the track, makes some room, and uses the angle to slap that away to the deep point boundary
fuller now, on off stump, driven to mid-off
comes down the track again and Richardson shortens his length. Looks to pull, misses, and it's off the body towards backward point
short now and he pulls it down to deep square leg
A bit of late drama, perhaps? It was a nicely timed drive down the ground from Duminy, and Richardson got a little fingertip on it bending down in his follow-through. Is Miller home? Yes, he is.
low full-toss on middle stump, and he scoops it over mid-on's head, didn't really get hold of it, but who cares, that's the winning single
